Check whether Mplus can be found

mplusAvailable.Rd

This is a simple utility to check whether Mplus can be found. Returns 0 if Mplus command can be found by the system. If silent = FALSE, prints a message to the user to help suggest what to do.

mplusAvailable(silent = TRUE)

Arguments

silent

A logical whether to print a message or not. Defaults to TRUE for silent operation.

Value

The status of finding Mplus. Per unix conventions, status 0 indicates Mplus was found (0 problems) and status 1 indicates that Mplus was not found.

Details

Note: This is copied directly from the MplusAutomation repository. This is because it is only available for the development version. When it is part of an update, it will be imported from MplusAutomation.

Examples


mplusAvailable(silent = TRUE)
mplusAvailable(silent = FALSE)
#> Mplus is either not installed or could not be found
#> Try installing Mplus or if it already is installed,
#> making sure it can be found by adding it to your PATH or adding a symlink
#> 
#> To see directories on your PATH, From a terminal, run:
#> 
#> echo $PATH
#> 
#> then try something along these lines:
#> 
#> sudo ln -s /path/to/mplus/on/your/system /directory/on/your/PATH
